repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Papers of the NAACP, Pt. 13, Series A, B, & C on Microfilm
did.abstract: Correspondence, press releases, and clippings regarding employment opportunities and traning programs for blacks in national defense industries. Principal correspondents: Sidney Hillman and Robert C. Weaver.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded Feb. 12. 1909, the NAACP is the nation's oldest, largest and most widely recognized grassroots-based civil rights organization. Its more than half-million members and supporters throughout the United States and the world are the premier advocates for civil rights in their communities, campaigning for equal opportunity and conducting voter mobilization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series A- 21 reels "Subject Files on Labor Conditions & Employment Discrimination"; Series B - 25 reels "Cooperation with Organized Labor"; Series C - 12 reels "Legal Department Files on Labor"

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the NAACP, Pt. 13, Series A, B, & C on Microfilm #5925 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
